page.title: 15THE OLD DAYS IN HIGHWOOD
page.content: I lived in this area when I was a boy.My father was the blacksmith and my uncle was the wheelwright.I think that the area changed unbelievably in 60 years. When I was a boy{most people lived {and worked in the area.}They hardly ever went anywhere.Now 2 men and ma- chines do the work of 20 men.Every- thing on farms was{done by hand}and there were some part-time jobs. {School}has changed so much.There was no school bus,no school dinners,no playing field and no secondary school. Discipline was strict and the cane was often used.Looking back I don't mind this discipline at school because we had laughs though life was harder. {Roads}were made of cobbles and ballast They were very muddy in wet weather. People used to walk long distances. They were the{best days}of my life.
